children.subject: Depends heavily on the course and the professor. It could be as late as July.

While Carlo is historically accurate, I believe we have a hiring deadline around (if not actually) June 1st--so it's unlikely it would be much longer than that. You can still take CS370 either way though!

thanks,

Christopher
Usually when will we notified if selected for a GSI position?
P/NP

It may be either, but you should plan on P/NP just to be safe. We've submitted for it to be reviewed in August, and if they approve then it will have a letter-grade option. Again there's no way to guarantee they rule that way, but I hope they do!

thanks,

Christopher
Just an update that is HAS been approved to be taken for a letter-grade or as P/NP--the choice is yours! I've sent emails to everyone admitted to the course today.
Will this class be offered on a P/NP basis or letter grade?

I'll begin enrolling the first admits to the course by the end of this week. This means you should see people being moved in at some point over the next 5 days. People will be enrolled into the course in the order they were accepted which is based on the application time stamp so regardless, it should be fair and it will happen.

thanks,

Christopher
I'll be enrolling students imminently now that the decision for letter-grade option has been released.
when will we be enrolled if we get in?

Great question! The first round of admits should be notified by the end of the week--then they'll be moved into the course. I've been evaluating applications each day, and it looks like we have about 90 approved at the moment--but I'll notify everyone at the same time.

Thanks!

Christopher
Just curious - is there still a fair amount of room for people to be accepted?
When will we know if we got in or not?
It does count as units so does count towards your unit maximums; if that is what you are asking. It's just as any other course would be as far as I understand.
does enrolling in this class affect our phase 1, phase 2, and adjustment period unit caps?
You can take the course before being a TA, and most students do take it earlier (a term or two before) though plenty take them concurrently too. I'd apply now since space is limited.
also, if one expects to hear back on a TA position in the next few weeks, does it make more sense to apply now or wait until then?
I'm in the same situation, also waiting to know if I got rejected.
I just got the email
Also got the email
I submitted my 370 application really early — I think the day it came out. If I haven't been notified yet does that mean that I've been rejected?

There's no deadline per se though we have been checking apps less frequently as summer has progressed. Everyone who has applied as of today has been notified if they were admitted or not (also today). If you did not receive an email then email me as something must have gone awry.
Hi, I submitted my application late (a month after this post), how do I know if I got in or not? Or was there a certain deadline?
I am curious as well!
Also interested in knowing
370 course staff member here--to my knowledge, we have not officially finished looking at apps just yet, in the sense that there are still open seats available; in any case, it can't hurt to apply!

Please *do* apply if you're interested. We have a select few seats available from some students who dropped, and I'm happy to manually enroll students who complete the application at the top of the this post.


You may also email me with, "CS370 Interested" in the subject line. Be sure to include your SID number, and if you prefer the Wednesday or Thursday lecture--both of which occur from 5:30pm-7:00pm in 310 Jacobs Hall. This will help me manually enroll you as quickly as possible.

Hope to see you this fall!

Christopher
I know this is really late, but is there any chance to get in if I enroll now?
Is there lecture today?

history.content:
CS370 Application: tinyurl.com/y66y6rs7
Applications are open for enrolling in CS370 for the Fall 2019 semester! We have increased capacity again, and will have class in 310 Jacobs Hall; we think we might be able to accommodate all demand. We will be reviewing applications once a week, and once you're accepted we will manually add you to the course with no further action necessary on your part.
 
The two lectures to choose from are as follows:
Wednesdays 5:00pm-6:30pm in 310 Jacobs or
Thursdays 5:00pm-6:30pm in 310 Jacobs
 
What is CS370?
CS370 is our course on adaptive teaching in CS, and it meets the course requirement for first-time TAs--though it can be taken as early as the semester following your completion of one of the following: Data8, CS10, CS61A, or EE16A.
 
This course is highly interactive with everyone participating in designing materials and resources to help you as a tutor, mentor, and TA--also, most of the material translates effectively to industry and academia. CS370 emphasizes adapting your teaching technique based on student learning styles and academic performance. It's also equity-oriented which means you learn how to apply different instructional methods and assessments to optimize learning for multiple student backgrounds and their preferred learning strategies.
 
Unlike CS375/EE375 this course is 3 units and does require tutoring each week (1-3 hours per week depending on your potential course staff roles; most non-TAs complete 3 hours per week). The difference in time commitment between 375 and 370 is about an hour per week, and the majority of students find it to be worthwhile, though the choice is entirely yours.
 
For more information, check out our website:

CS370 Official Website

Please complete the application using this tinyurl:
tinyurl.com/y66y6rs7
 
Thank you and spread the word to those who might be interested!
 
-Christopher-
 
PS Email me at cthunn@berkeley.edu with questions; just put CS370 in the subject line. Thanks again!
